modules.description: This module processes type declarations to generate validation functions for OCaml data structures. It transforms type definitions into corresponding validation bindings and signature items, supporting both implementation and interface generation. It is used to automatically derive validation logic for recursive and non-recursive algebraic data types during compilation.

This module offers validation operations for enforcing data integrity through structural constraints, pattern matching, and value comparisons. It works with strings, lists, options, and generic values, supporting validations like length checks, regex conformance (URLs, UUIDs, IPs), and semantic rules (email formats, numeric ranges). Its structured error handling makes it suitable for input validation in APIs, form processing, and data pipeline integrity checks where precise failure diagnostics are critical.
